page.title: 08Ditton Community Centre
page.content: This was opened in 1973 by Ian Lavender (Pte. Pike of "Dads' Army"). It was extended in 1976 and 1979. The Centre has a large hall holding 400 with a stage. There is a meetings room and another room for parties and weddings etc. which holds 100. Showers and changing rooms are provided. Two tennis courts, two football pitches and a cricket pitch are outside. On weekdays there is a Playgroup & Toddler Club, Keepfit, Badminton, Table Tennis and Indoor Bowls. Elderly people in the village have lunch at the Centre once a week. Mothers bring their babies to the Clinic. Dog owners bring their pets to be trained. Some weekend activities are Discos, Dances, Roller Skating, Indoor Tennis and Craft Markets. The Parish Council own the Centre and meet there regularly.
